alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 11:16AM AKST until January 02 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST SUNDAY NIGHT SOUTH OF COPPER CENTER... * WHAT...Snow and freezing rain expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches and ice accumulation of one to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...South of Copper Center in the Copper River Basin, including The Edgerton Highway and Chitina as well as the Richardson Highway toward Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From 6 AM Sunday to midnight AKST Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop Saturday night, then transition to freezing rain Sunday morning. There is quite a bit of uncertainty in the track of this storm, so exact timing and amount of precipitation could change. However, the worst conditions are expected during the day Sunday, with highest snow and ice accumulations south of the Edgerton Highway down to Thompson Pass. Precipitation is expected to fall as all snow from Copper Center northward.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
